creator: sanry@now.net.cn
text:
I test for 2 days for this crash when I add SSL with apache2.0.49
That at last I find out that when apache2.0.49  display page :
http://www.todayisp.com/email/index.net  the apache2 will crash.

first I think it is the bug with php4.3.6 
but than I configure it with no php just html in 218.104.199.92/email2/
the apache2 still crash show up like the following 

At last I find out the reason is that this page have a special flash 
name in http://www.todayisp.com/email/images/promail2004.swf .
you can save as the page http://www.todayisp.com/email/index.net and
place it in the newly config apache2 , it will crash in IE6.0
  
cat error_log
[Wed Apr 21 21:30:32 2004] [error] [client 219.235.211.237] File does not 
exist: /usr/local/apache2/htdocs/images
[Wed Apr 21 21:30:36 2004] [error] [client 219.235.211.237] File does not 
exist: /usr/local/apache2/htdocs/share, referer: https://218.104.199.92/email2/
[Wed Apr 21 21:30:36 2004] [error] [client 219.235.211.237] File does not 
exist: /usr/local/apache2/htdocs/images, referer: https://218.104.199.92/email2/
[Wed Apr 21 21:30:36 2004] [error] [client 219.235.211.237] File does not 
exist: /usr/local/apache2/htdocs/news, referer: https://218.104.199.92/email2/
[Wed Apr 21 21:30:36 2004] [error] [client 219.235.211.237] File does not 
exist: /usr/local/apache2/htdocs/images, referer: https://218.104.199.92/email2/
[Wed Apr 21 21:30:36 2004] [error] [client 219.235.211.237] File does not 
exist: /usr/local/apache2/htdocs/product, referer: 
https://218.104.199.92/email2/
[Wed Apr 21 21:30:36 2004] [error] [client 219.235.211.237] File does not 
exist: /usr/local/apache2/htdocs/product, referer: 
https://218.104.199.92/email2/
[Wed Apr 21 21:30:36 2004] [error] [client 219.235.211.237] File does not 
exist: /usr/local/apache2/htdocs/images, referer: https://218.104.199.92/email2/
[Wed Apr 21 21:30:36 2004] [error] [client 219.235.211.237] File does not 
exist: /usr/local/apache2/htdocs/product, referer: 
https://218.104.199.92/email2/
[Wed Apr 21 21:30:37 2004] [notice] child pid 5046 exit signal Segmentation 
fault (11)

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
Can you get a core dump and a backtrace?

Fix for one known cause of segfaults in 2.0.49:

http://cvs.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi/httpd-2.0/modules/ssl/ssl_engine_io.c?r1=1.121&r2=1.122

Presume this is bug 27945.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 27945 ***
creator: jorton@redhat.com
